verses.roman:
tan-mātā koṭarā nāma
nagnā makta-śiroruhā
puro 'vatasthe kṛṣṇasya
putra-prāṇa-rirakṣayā

synonyms: tat—his (Bāṇāsura's); mātā—mother; koṭarā nāma—named Koṭarā; nagnā—naked; mukta—loosened; śiraḥ-ruhā—her hair; puraḥ—in front; avatasthe—stood; kṛṣṇasya—of Kṛṣṇa; putra—her son's; prāṇa—life; rirakṣayā—hoping to save.
translation: Just then Bāṇāsura's mother, Koṭarā, desiring to save her son's life, appeared before Lord Kṛṣṇa naked and with her hair undone.
